components.title: Oncoming Bus

description: The front of a bus, showing the windscreen,¬†as well as wing mirrors in some versions of this emoji.
title: Oncoming Bus

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.definition: The front of a bus, showing the windscreen,¬†as well as wing mirrors in some versions of this emoji. Oncoming Bus was approved as part of Uni http://emojipedia.org/oncoming-bus/
emoji_net_data.name: oncoming bus

bn:00084303v: To transport students to school, often to a more distant school for the purposes of achieving racial integration.
Send or move around by bus

bn:00084790v: To move or pass from one place, person or thing to another.
To move persons from one place to another.
To send or convey something from one person, place or thing to another.
To move data from one location to another.
To send or convey from someone, some place or something to another.
Send from one person or place to another
To carry or bear from one place to another; to remove; to convey.
To send information over a communications line or a circuit.

bn:00085445v: To reverse, as the order of the letters h and t in hte, in correcting the spelling of the; or reversing two wires in a circuit.
To reverse or change the order of (two or more things); to swap or interchange.
To change the order of something.
Change the order or arrangement of

bn:00078004n: A facility consisting of the means and equipment necessary for the movement of passengers or goods
Shared passenger transport service which is available for use by the general public
The act or the means of conveying people in mass as opposed to conveyance in private vehicles.
Any form of transport that can be used by a member of public (usually for a fee); as opposed to private ownership of e.g. cars.

Public transport is a shared passenger transport service which is available for use by the general public, as distinct from modes such as taxicab, carpooling or hired buses which are not shared by strangers without private arrangement.
The conveyance of people or goods from one place to another, especially on a public transportation system; the vehicles used for such conveyance.
The conveyance of people or goods from one place to another.

bn:00007329n: A large, long-bodied motor vehicle equipped with seating for passengers, usually operating as part of a scheduled service.
A vehicle set up to carry many people (now usually called a bus).
A vehicle, usually a bus or coach, with two decks.
An automotive vehicle for long-distance travel
Motor bus or motorbus is a now somewhat archaic term referring to a bus powered by an onboard internal combustion engine, as opposed to a horse-drawn bus, steam bus or trolleybus.
A vehicle carrying many passengers; used for public transport
A charabanc or "char-√†-banc" is a type of horse-drawn vehicle or early motor coach, usually open-topped, common in Britain during the early part of the 20th century.
A coach is a type of bus used for conveying passengers on excursions and on longer distance intercity bus service between cities -- or even between countries.
A single decked long-distance, or privately hired bus.
A bus that is a motor vehicle, as opposed to earlier horse-drawn buses.
A bus is a road vehicle designed to carry many passengers.
